newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland has 5,234 petrol stations - report.
newsitem.headline: Poland has 5,234 petrol stations - report.

text.p: Poland had 5,234 petrol stations in January this year, of which 26 percent belonged to the state-owned network CPN SA, according to a report by a private fuel retailers organisation.

The report by the Polish Liquid Fuels Chamber published by newspapers on Friday said CPN owned 1,367 stations while state-owned refineries, Petrochemia Plock SA and Rafineria Gdansk SA, controlled 190 and 79 respectively.
Plock and Gdansk are to be partially sold off next year under the government's oil sector privatisation scheme, which also provides for giving investors in the refineries access to CPN's chain.
The report said Norway's state-owned firm Statoil was fourth biggest fuel retailer with 43 stations, followed by Royal/Dutch Shell with 30 stations.
DuPont's unit Conoco was eigth on the list with 18 stations behind domestic companies.
All the foreign companies have earlier said they planned further expansion in Poland.
